basic.description: This course introduces students to the sociology of family diversity. Topics normally considered include diversity of family forms; social constructions of motherhood and fatherhood; contested understandings of families; and how contemporary debates about gender differences, sexualities, and racialization may inform the understanding of intimate and familial relations.
basic.subject: SOCY
basic.title: Family Diversity

extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE  A grade of C- in SOCY122/6.0
